title: Current Turrets are Pathetic
body:
I know turrets are always a hot topic and changes have been done last season to accommodate towards weak Turret dmg. 

However, for this current mastery page and a new **4-man-dive-Meta** Turrets are NOT scary.

Turrets are weak, worth 400 gold, and MELT just by looking at them. 

Turrets should hit much Harder like they do in Twisted Treeline. They melt ANY HP and ANY armor.

_**MAKE TURRETS GREAT AGAIN 2017!**_

Now maybe i could overlook weak outer and inner turrets if inhib turrets had something special to them like armor ignore and slightly increased fire rate.

I think we want to both preserve the sanctity of laning phase as well as allowing for progression in game state. 

If bot lane is both low, I think it's completely appropriate to be able to have a 3v2 dive with the minion wave, kill both and escape. Without the minion wave, should be very difficult. 

I think if bot is both full health, neither outcome should be guaranteed in a 3v2 (or 4v3) dive (there should be outplay potential on both sides), but in a 4v2 dive, I would expect both players to die. 

Personally, I think 4v2 dives are very telegraphed and you have ample time to leave if jungle isn't there to countergank (or at least ward to prepare and call mid lane to prepare for rotation and get cleanup). 

I think it's unreasonable to expect a turret to defend you from a 4v2 dive with a minion wave (turret would pretty much have to 3 hit KO you), but if defense in a full health 2v3 or 3v4 is failing, that's something we can look at.

There is some pretty goofy dives that succeed these days. Champs with no armor and small health pools diving turrets and surviving. It just seems like turrets aren't so much weak as they are slow as balls. Like painfully slow to do anything in a game that feels like it is only getting faster in tempo. So many mobility moves are .5 second dashes and blinks. Have you guys experimented with speeding up shots and targeting instead of increasing health and damage? Also shattering defense after 5 shots or something would make it so the 4k health tank can't just tank 20 shots. I get being able to tank it longer because you're beefy but removing a mechanic completely because of a stat check is pretty meh.

We experimented for quite a while with a change to fundamental turret rules, specifically "turret memory". Essentially if you ever took aggro, you would go on a "shitlist" and the turret would resume attacking you if it ever dropped aggro from another target. 

It ended up being very confusing (and a lot more complexity for relatively little gain) and we had some unfortunate side effects with clones and summons. For example - if I use Tibbers to aggro someone and then walk him out, should the turret then attack Annie even before she casts anything? Same with Zyra plants, voidlings. 

For Shaco clone, turret always knows which one is real, so if a clone draws aggro, Turret should attack the real Shaco, so you always know which one is real. 

I would say there are still improvements to be made to turrets - out of the ones you mentioned, increasing attack speed and lowering damage seems promising?

Sorry i meant "increasing attack speed and lowering damage" - together. Means that turrets are more consistent at defending (and less game-able). However, can slightly lower skill expression for champs like Riven and Trynd (sometimes runs back to turret to take the last turret hit before ult falls off) that rely on diving and surviving the last turret shot.
It also completely changes the way how CSing under towers works. I'd argue that this is fundamental to the game and actually more important than the actual strength of towers.

Speaking of which, I'd love to see that damage tweaked further so that low-AD champions (such as certain mages and supports) can actually use the standard "two tower shots and an auto" to last-hit melee minions.  That often doesn't work right now because of their low AD not being enough to finish a minion after two two shots.
Turrets were already changed to do percent HP damage on minions, so lowering their AD has no impact on that front.

Nah, I'm saying mid can follow and if all lanes are losing (ie. enemy bot has priority to push you in + mid can roam without being followed + your jungle doesn't have priority) then yeah, you probably have to give up the turret). Bot usually can't/shouldn't roam, just has to play a bit more cautiously if they're receiving a lot of attention.  

I've been Diamond for ~3.5 seasons and an AD main for at least half of it and I can say with great confidence that 4v2 dives get botched a lot more than you'd think. Sometimes they go for it, then jungle counterganks from a good angle (eg. unseen from lane or gets a good rotation), or top TP's behind, or mid just follows - maybe a clutch exhaust from supp, or flash outplay from AD. 

I agree the situation is not optimal, especially for bot lane agency and perception is definitely that bot is a shit show clown fiesta party, but at the same time, I think there's a lot of sensationalism of how dire the situation is. 

People claiming that you can 4v2 dive full health bot laners at level 2/3 is pretty absurd. As the bot lane players, if you manage to thin out the wave as it's pushing into turret, you can stall the dive or make it a lot more risky for them to go for it.  

The TLDR is that most of the time, your team has to be pretty far behind for you to be getting 4v2 dived with no recourse or strategical counterplay.

Most supports can't clear period, they've been specifically designed for that because they aren't allowed to go into solo lanes (Despite mages being allowed to go bot and fully endorsed by Riot, hello {{champion:63}} ) and not all ADC's have a good source of waveclear, and even if they do they'll still need to throw some autos in there and most people aren't willing to do that when at least three enemies are closing in on their turret with a fourth potentially on the way.

Also, your team doesn't need to be very far behind at all. Rarely does a "party" in bot lane happen just if one side is weaker than the other, in fact, I've experienced more games where we got five maned bot because we were WINNING lane and everyone else on the enemy team decided to say nope to that and just crush us. Most of the time it's just based on whoever happens to have a mid/top/jung that has a mind to go bot.
